main event: An orange-colored light, approximately the size of an orange held at arm's length, was observed flying over San Antonio, Texas.
interesting points: The object was observed flying a straight and level flight path.
The object was observed for 2-4 seconds before disappearing from view.
The observer initially thought the object was a shooting star, but noted it was too low and large to be a star.
The object was orange in color, unlike typical white-colored shooting stars.
The winds at different altitudes were reported in the document.
result: The cause of the sighting was unknown.
